page.title: 16The Parish Church
page.content: Although parts of today's churchdate back to the l3th century the original building was much older. There are some Saxon stones which suggest that there might have been a church on the site even before the original Norman building. The chancel and the font date back to Norman times. Nothing remains of the Norman nave. The north doorway dates back to the l3th century,the roof to the l5th century and the main door is Tudor. Some of the bells were cast in the l7th century and some in the l9th century. Near the chancel arch is a statue of Mary holding the infant Jesus. This is a modern statue carved from a single piece of apple wood. Services are still held regularly. Sometimes we hold our end of term service in the church.
